      • onMapReady

        public void onMapReady(com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap googleMap)
        Manipulates the map once available. This callback is triggered when the map is ready to be used. This is where we can add markers or lines, add listeners or move the camera. In this case, we just add a marker near Sydney, Australia. If Google Play services is not installed on the device, the user will be prompted to install it inside the SupportMapFragment. This method will only be triggered once the user has installed Google Play services and returned to the app.
        Specified by:
        onMapReady in interface com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback

      • onMyLocationClick

        public void onMyLocationClick(@NonNull
                              android.location.Location location)
        Handles the click of the current location of the user. This method is overriding a method by the Google MAPs API
        Specified by:
        onMyLocationClick in interface com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap.OnMyLocationClickListener
        Parameters:
        location - Loc of the current user

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)
        This is method is called when the device suffers any changes, such as screen rotation or change of the screensize. We save variables in order to be accessed one those changes have finished, in order to give a better user experience to the user.
        Overrides:
        onSaveInstanceState in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:

      • onMapClick

        private void onMapClick(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng latLng)
        Actions to be done when the map is clicked by the user
        Parameters:
        latLng - Latitude and longitude of the tap position on the map

      • manageLocationPermission

        private void manageLocationPermission()
        Manage the local permission, if the user does grant the LOCATION permission we continue showing the map. If not we can not set the current user location and we try to setup everything so that the user does not run into any problems.

      • setMyLocationEnabled

        private void setMyLocationEnabled()
        After performing the permission checks this method allows to access user location

      • setupBottomSheet

        Setup the bottom sheet used for setting the preferences for the matching

        Parameters:

      • getLocationName

        public void getLocationName(android.location.Location location)
        Creates an intent, adds location data to it as an extra, and starts the intent service for fetching an address.

      • getDeviceLocation

        private void getDeviceLocation(com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnCompleteListener onCompleteListener)
        Get the best and most recent location of the device, which may be null in rare cases when a location is not available. Important: This runs on other thread, assigning variables to it will give an error. Only set things on the OnComplete callback

      • setUpOnCompleteListeners

        private void setUpOnCompleteListeners()
        SetUp the completion listeners for the move and animate camera methods. When the user starts the app we want to move the camera fast to some position without any animation. If they click the button "MyLocation" show the animation and move smoothly to the required position

      • setCurrentFocusedTextViewLocation

        private void setCurrentFocusedTextViewLocation(android.location.Location location)
        Sets the location string to the focused textview when the location string is found in the other thread
        Parameters:
        location -

                      com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng destPosition)
